creator: seanhodgins
title: MegaMUX - 32 Channel Multiplexer Tutorial
description: This project is a tutorial on how to use the ADG732 32-channel multiplexer with an Arduino. The MegaMUX board allows you to connect one output and select between 32 different inputs/outputs, effectively expanding the Arduino's GPIO capabilities.
steps: Watch the video for a detailed explanation of the Arduino programs.
Gather the required parts: PCB, ADG732, 0.1uF and 1uF capacitors, header pins, Arduino board, jumper wires, breadboard, soldering iron, solder, solder flux, and tweezers.
Solder the ADG732, capacitors, and header pins onto the PCB.

Connect the MegaMUX to the Arduino according to the following pinout: MegaMUX VCC to Arduino 3.3V, GND to GND, A0 to GPIO13, A1 to GPIO12, A2 to GPIO11, A3 to GPIO10, A4 to GPIO9, CS to GPIO8, WR to GPIO7, EN to GPIO6, and IO to A0.
To test the output program, connect each IO pin of the MUX to an LED with a suitable resistor in series, and upload the provided Arduino output test program. The LEDs should cycle through each pin.

To test the analog input program, connect photoresistors to IO pins 1-16 on the MUX, set up the output pin as a voltage divider, and upload the provided Arduino input test program. The program will cycle through the photoresistors, allowing you to sample from each one, which can be viewed in the Arduino IDE Serial Plotter.
Explore other potential uses for the MegaMUX to expand the GPIO capabilities of the Arduino.
